title.rendered: 100 Top FutureLearn Courses of All Time

content.rendered:
The online learning platform FutureLearn offers close to 2000 courses on a wide variety of subjects, some of them free: 100+ FutureLearn Courses with Free Certificate.

In this Class Central ranking, we’ve compiled the 100 most popular courses on FutureLearn, for your learning pleasure. If you’d like to take one, our colleague Pat wrote a guide on how to sign up.

Platform Overview

FutureLearn can be seen as the European counterpart to Coursera and edX. The platform was founded by the Open University (OU) in late 2013, and is now jointly owned by the OU and SEEK. We’ve been tracking its evolution since the very beginning, most notably, through our end-of-year series:

  • FutureLearn 2021: Year in Review
  • FutureLearn 2020: Year in Review
  • FutureLearn 2019: Year in Review

FutureLearn’s offerings range from short classes to full-fledged online degrees, including close to 2000 online courses, most created by partner universities across the Commonwealth.

The platform offers a subscription, FutureLearn Unlimited, as well as a signature microcredential, ExpertTracks, which resemble Coursera and edX’s Professional Certificates. Pat reviewed an ExpertTrack here.

To help you cut through the noise and find the platform’s best offerings, we’ve compiled FutureLearn’s 100 top online courses.

More Courses

If you don’t find what you need in the course list below, Class Central’s got you covered. Browse our catalog of over 100K courses or visit our thematic collections:

  • Class Central’s Best Online Courses of All Time
  • Massive List of Thousands of Free Certificates and Badges
  • 1600+ Coursera Courses That Are Still Completely Free
  • 800+ Hours of Free LinkedIn Learning Courses with Free Certification
  • 800+ Open University Free Certificates

To see all our compilations, visit Class Central’s Collections.

Ranking Stats

Combined, FutureLearn’s 100 most-popular courses have accrued 14M enrollments, with 145K enrollments per course on average. There are 4 organizations and over 40 universities represented in the course ranking. But one third of the courses were created by just 4 prolific organizations and universities:

  1. University of Leeds
  2. University of Reading
  3. British Council
  4. Accenture

Here are more quick stats on the ranking:

  • Course enrollments range from 53K to 810K.
  • There are 19 courses with over 200K enrollments.
  • Combined, they represent 1000+ hours of content.
  • All courses are in English but one, that is in Dutch.
  • 93 courses are free-to-audit and 8 offer a free certificate.
  • 52 courses are beginner level and 16 intermediate. The others are cross-level.
  • Almost 40% of the courses are in the field of Health & Medicine and Humanities.

Without further ado, here are FutureLearn’s top 100 courses.

100 Most Popular FutureLearn Courses

Here are the top 100 futurelearn courses, sorted by number of enrollments:
